title: Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse are all smiles before Strictly practice
text:
The two will be dancing to Billie Eilish’s Bad Guy (Picture: Backgrid)

Strictly Come Dancing’s Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse were all smiles as they made their way to rehearsal amid romance rumours.

Oti was happy to wave at the cameras while Kelvin looked to be in a serious conversation on the phone.

He was probably trying to explain to someone the absurdity of the Strictly curse.

The two looked like they moved past the stress they endured rehearsing for their previous Cha Cha routine and are ready to rock their new Halloween tango to Billie Eilish’s Bad Guy.

Oti was a lot happier to walk into rehearsal than Kelvin (Picture: Strictly / BACKGRID)

Kelvin, on the other hand, was not so chipper (Picture: Strictly / BACKGRID)

Kelvin and Oti, 29, admitted they ‘came to blows’ ahead of their last Strictly Come Dancing performance.

The pair, who have been delighting BBC One viewers ever since the competition started, danced to the Cha Cha to Aston Merrygold’s banger, Get Stupid.

Advertisement

Advertisement

However, it seems they had been clashing behind the scenes before Saturday night’s show.

Taking to Instagram, professional dancer Oti gave fans a glimpse into how rehearsals had been going.

In a video posted on the professional dancer’s story, she told her 294k followers: ‘It is Friday. Fantastic freaky Friday.’

After the Emmerdale actor showed off his twerking skills, he confessed: ‘It’s been a hard week. A hard week.’

‘It’s been very emotional,’ his partner agreed, while the 35-year-old said: ‘We came to blows a few times…’

Only a few more days to go! (Picture: Guy Levy/BBC/PA Wire)

Guys, was just a Cha Cha!

Oti then added: ‘We got there in the end. And I’m excited.’

While they may have clashed about the last dance, the pair have definitely made up as they look closer than ever as they rehearse for this week’s Halloween special.

Strictly Come Dancing continues on Saturday, at 6.35 pm, on BBC One.

description: Strictly Come Dancing's Oti Mabuse and Kelvin Fletcher are in high spirits as they head to rehearsals for this week's Halloween routine.
